import React from 'react' import Header from './Header' import Nav from './Nav' import Footer from './Footer' import Home from './Home' import NewPost from './NewPost' import Postpage from './Postpage' import Missing from './Missing' import About from './About' import {useState,useEffect} from 'react' import { BrowserRouter as Router, Route, Switch,useHistory} from 'react-router-dom'; function App() { const [allposts,setAllposts]=useState([ { id: 1, title: "Introduction to React Hooks", timeAndDate: "May 1, 2023 10:00 AM", body: "React Hooks provide a way to add state and lifecycle methods to functional components. They offer a more concise and readable syntax compared to class components." }, { id: 2, title: "Exploring JavaScript Promises", timeAndDate: "June 15, 2023 2:30 PM", body: "JavaScript Promises are a powerful feature for handling asynchronous operations. They allow you to write cleaner and more manageable code for tasks like fetching data from APIs." }, { id: 3, title: "Getting Started with Node.js", timeAndDate: "July 5, 2023 11:45 AM", body: "Node.js is a runtime environment that allows you to run JavaScript code on the server side. It's popular for building scalable and efficient web applications." }, { id: 4, title: "Introduction to CSS Grid Layout", timeAndDate: "August 20, 2023 4:00 PM", body: "CSS Grid Layout is a powerful tool for creating responsive and flexible grid-based layouts in web design. It offers precise control over grid items and their placement." }, { id: 5, title: "Best Practices for React Component Design", timeAndDate: "September 10, 2023 9:15 AM", body: "Designing React components involves following best practices such as using functional components, organizing code structure, and optimizing performance for better user experience." } ] ) console.log(allposts) const h=useHistory(); const deletepost=(e,id)=>{ e.prevent console.log(id) console.log("deleet called") const newposts=allposts.filter((ele)=>ele.id!=id) setAllposts(newposts) h.push("/") } return (
); } export default App;
